The page I believe they should link back to is here: <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/master/api_guides/python/math_ops#Segmentation>https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/master/api_guides/python/math_ops#Segmentation</denchmark-link>
I came here because I haven't grokked just what segmented operations are yet. So I would be much obliged if the explanation of segmentation were more thoroughly be explained there, perhaps with a couple of examples. I found [a few places] in the code where this could be address. And I would have attempted a pull request to fix these, but I'm not up on how to generate the documentation to verify that it was fixed.

comments.comment: Thanks for the report, the documentation is indeed broken. Looking into a fix. As a workaround in the mean time, you can see the images at <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/images/SegmentProd.png>https://www.tensorflow.org/images/SegmentProd.png</denchmark-link> etc.

While you're at it, I noticed that on the unsorted_segment_sum page, it refers to perhaps an older naming scheme: "Unlike SegmentSum, segment_ids need not be sorted and need not cover all values in the full range of valid values."
